p: Sophora alopecuroides L. is a medicinal plant widely distributed in Western and Central Asia, especially in China. Sophora alopecuroides L. has been used for decades to treat fever, bacterial infections, heart disease, rheumatism, and gastrointestinal diseases. Aloperine ( 1), a quinolizidine-type alkaloid, was first isolated from the seeds and leaves of Sophora alopecuroides L. To evaluate the anti-HIV activity of aloperine, HIV-1 NL4-3 NanoLuc-sec virus infection of MT4 cells was performed in the presence of various concentrations of aloperine. Aloperine showed anti-HIV activity with an EC 50 value of 1.75 ± 0.59 μM. BMS-806-resistant, Env-mediated cell-cell fusion, such as that mediated by YU2-T198P and 8x, may be inhibited by aloperine. 29
